title: 110_hr2943
content: The Act titled "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2007" addresses the treatment of service-connected disabilities rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for purposes of the Social Security Act. The "Benefit Rating Acceleration for Veteran Entitlements Act of 2007" allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be deemed disabled for Social Security benefits upon presenting certification to the Commissioner of Social Security. The Act allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be deemed disabled for Social Security benefits upon certification to the Commissioner. If the disability ceases or the individual can engage in substantial gainful activity, the certification must be promptly made to the Commissioner by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Act allows individuals with a service-connected disability rated as total by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be deemed disabled for Social Security benefits upon certification to the Commissioner. The Commissioner's determination of disability is based on earnings evidence, not medical recovery. This does not prevent a disability determination under this title for individuals not deemed disabled under the Act. The Commissioner of Social Security and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will collaborate as needed to implement these provisions. Amendments are made to sections 202(f)(1) and 223(d)(7) of the Act regarding widower's insurance benefits and disability determinations for entitlement to benefits under the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to sections 202(f)(1) and 223(d)(7) of the Social Security Act, specifying regulations for disability determinations and entitlement to benefits. Additionally, section 216(i) is amended to include provisions for individuals with disabilities.
